name: The Woman
customCr: 24 (62,000 XP) or 25 (75,000 XP) when encountered in lair
legendariesDescription: The [MON] can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The [MON] regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
lairDescription: When fighting inside its lair, the [MON] can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the [MON] can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:
lairDescriptionEnd: The [MON] can't repeat an effect until they have all been used, and it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.
regionalDescription: The region containing the lich's lair is warped by the creature's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:
regionalDescriptionEnd: If the lich dies, the first two effects fade over the course of 3d10 days.

abilities.name: Eyes Beyond Time
abilities.desc: The [MON] has advantage on Intelligence (History) checks.

abilities.name: Magical Resistance
abilities.desc: The [MON] has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

abilities.name: Robe of Stars
abilities.desc: The [MON] has a +1 bonus to saving throws.

abilities.name: Stanger's Veil
abilities.desc: The [MON] has advantage on all checks made to hide their identity. In addition, after interacting with the [MON], creatures must succeed a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or forget the interaction over the next few days. A creature attuned to a Nighteye Dagger automatically succeeds.

abilities.name: Temporal Awareness
abilities.desc: The [MON] adds **[INT]** to their initiative rolls.

abilities.name: War Caster
abilities.desc: The [MON] has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain your concentration on a spell.

abilities.name: Wreathed in the Unknowable
abilities.desc: The [MON] is hidden from divination magic and can't be perceived through magical scrying sensors. When a creature targets the [MON] using the scrying spell or similar spell, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against it's own save DC or take [3d8] psychic damage.

abilities.name: Spellcasting
abilities.desc:
The [MON] is an 19th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC [INT SAVE + 2], [INT ATK + 2] to hit with spell attacks). The [MON] has the following wizard spells prepared:

>Cantrip (at will): _light, mage hand, prestidigitation, sapping sting, toll the dead_
>Ritual Spells (at will): _comprehend languages, find familiar, identify, leomund's tiny hut, 
rary's telepathic bond, unseen servant_
>1st (4 slots): _chromatic orb, color spray, disguise self, shield_
>2nd (3 slots): _fortune's favor, mirror image, misty step^, scorching ray_
>3rd (3 slots): _counterspell, fireball, tongues_
>4th (2 slots): _**arcane eye**, dimension door, **greater invisibility**_
>5th (2 slots): _**bigby's hand**, **modify memory**, temporal shunt_
>6th (1 slot): _chain lightning, disintegrate_
>7th (1 slot): _plane shift, **tether essence**_
>8th (1 slot): **_maddening darkness**, **reality break**_
>9th (1 slot): _time ravage, time stop_
_bonus action^;**concentration**_

abilities.name: Spell Mastery
abilities.desc: The [MON] can cast the _shield_ spell and the _misty step_ spell without expending a spell slot.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: _Ranged Weapon Attack:_ +7 to hit, (80/320), one creature. _Hit:_ [1d8+1] piercing damage.

actions.name: Walk Through Planes
actions.desc: The [MON] enters the _Astral Plane_ and remains there until they use an action to return to the plane they were on. The [MON] reappears in the last space they occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space.

actions.name: Tharizdun's Bolt (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The [MON] selects one creature it can see that can see it with in 60 ft. The creature hit must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or experience short-term madness for 1 hour or long-term madness for 10 minutes. Consult the Short-Term and Long-Term Madness tables (see "Madness Effects" in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide) to determine the form of the madness. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of every 10 minutes if inflicted with short-term madness or at the end of each minute for long-term madness, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Momentary Stasis (6/day)
actions.desc: The [MON] can force a Large or smaller creature within 60 feet to make a DC [INT SAVE] Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated and has a speed of 0 until the end of the [MON]'s next turn or until the creature takes any damage.

actions.name: Robe of Stars (6 Charges; Recharges 1d6 at Dusk)
actions.desc: By expending a charge, the [MON] casts _magic missile_ as a 5th-level spell _(7 darts)_.

reactions.name: Chronal Shift (2/day)
reactions.desc: After anyone within 30 feet of the [MON] makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, they can force the creature to reroll. The target must use the result of the second roll.

reactions.name: Convergent Future
reactions.desc: When anyone makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, within 60 feet of the [MON], they can use a reaction to ignore the die roll and decide whether the number rolled is the minimum needed to succeed or one less than that number. When the [MON] use this feature, they gain one level of exhaustion.

reactions.name: War Caster
reactions.desc: When a creature's provokes an opportunity attack, the [MON] can cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack.

legendaries.name: Cast Spell (Costs 1â€“3 Actions)
legendaries.desc: The [MON] uses a spell slot to cast a 1st-, 2nd-, or 3rd-level spell that it has prepared. Doing so costs 1 legendary action per level of the spell.

lairs.name: Regain Spells
lairs.desc: The [MON] rolls a d8 and regains a spell slot of that level or lower. If they have no spent spell slots of that level or lower, nothing happens.

lairs.name: Anti-Magic Field
lairs.desc: The [MON] targets one 30 ft circle within 60. Blinky is forced to project its eye in that direction and that area is under the effect of the _anti-magic field_ spell until the next turn.

lairs.name: Temporal Anomoly
lairs.desc: The [MON] exacerbates a temporal anomaly in its lair. This abnormality materializes around one creatures they can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking [15d6] force or psychic damage (your choice) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. The anomaly then disappears.

specialdamage.name: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
